works.description: We have seen a variety of materials being used on vehicles, to give them their own unique appeal and create an impression into everyone’s minds, like in our coverage of Gold-plated cars and the custom made Wooden Ariel Square vehicle that primarily used wooden finish on its body. Creating a similar unique impression is the 1939 Ghost Pontiac Plexiglas deluxe, which is incidentally the first transparent vehicle, made in America. This ‘ghost’ vehicle emulates all designing cues of the original Pontiac, but displays its mechanical components with complete clarity.
